definition: to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding

sentences.english: The poor old man plods along, hardly able to lift each food.
sentences.chinese: 这可怜白勺白叟吃力地走着，几乎都抬不动脚了。

sentences.english: The soldiers laboured their way in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们在暴风雨中吃力地前进。

sentences.english: May be hard to pull off in some hilly cities.
sentences.chinese: 在平原城市还好，在丘陵城市就有点吃力了。

sentences.english: Eg. I'm browned off with working so hard for so little money.
sentences.chinese: 工作这么吃力，钱又这么少，够她受的。

sentences.english: With heavy knapsacks on their backs, the explorers plodded on their way up the snow-covered mountains.
sentences.chinese: 探险家们身背沉重的背包，吃力地，一步步地爬上。

sentences.english: Now, Bill came in sight plodding up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 就在这时，比尔出现了，他正吃力地从山下爬上来。

sentences.english: The old car was labouring along the muddy road.
sentences.chinese: 那辆旧车在泥泞的路上吃力地朝前开着。

sentences.english: She struggled for breath, to be calm.
sentences.chinese: 她吃力地呼吸着，强作镇定。

sentences.english: Susch parts are often considered to be thankless, unrewarding.
sentences.chinese: 这种角色通常被变为是吃力不讨好的。

sentences.english: The tank laboriously crawled on with a huddle of soldiers hanging behind.
sentences.chinese: 坦克吃力地爬行着，一堆士兵缩在后面跟着走。

sentences.english: They jumped (over) the ditch without much difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 他们不太吃力地就跳过了那道沟。

sentences.english: Kelly: Did you hear the somersault marathon? It is truly straining.
sentences.chinese: 你听说过翻跟头马拉松吗？那才叫吃力呢。

sentences.english: He trudged the deserted road for hours.
sentences.chinese: 他沿著荒芜的道路吃力地走了几个小时。

sentences.english: Finally, it all came to a halt, with only Leehom's laboured breathing punctuating the silence.
sentences.chinese: 最后，一切静止，只剩力宏吃力的呼吸，打破寂静。

sentences.english: For the homemaker water hardness makes home cleaning operations more difficult.
sentences.chinese: 硬水让主妇的家居日常清洁工作更加吃力。

sentences.english: In addition, the son has struggled to write legibly.
sentences.chinese: 另外，她儿子对于简单明了的写字显得很吃力。

definition: to expend a great deal of effort
to require effort/strenuous
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]
to be unable to tolerate or endure/to find sth difficult to manage
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
unripe/tart/not fully proficient/somewhat shaky
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
the will is there, but not the strength (idiom)/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
pinyin: xin1 you3 yu2 er2 li4 bu4 zu2

definition: tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
rope/to bind together/to twist around
surname Lei
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
heavy/cumbersome/unwieldy
slow/sluggish
awkward/difficult/uncomfortable/not agreeing/at loggerheads/gauche
clumsy/awkward/stupid
reliable/secure/stable/firm
